title: Leave Guidelines
summary: Guidance on leave types, eligibility, approvals and documentation.
body:
## Purpose
This policy defines how employees request and take leave, ensuring fairness, compliance, and business continuity.

## Leave Types
- **Annual leave:** Paid time off accrued monthly.
- **Sick leave:** For illness; medical certificate required if >2 days.
- **Emergency leave:** Unplanned urgent situations; manager notification ASAP.
- **Maternity/Paternity:** Per local law and company provisions.
- **Unpaid leave:** Manager + HR approval required.

## Eligibility
- Full-time employees accrue leave from day 1.
- Part-time/contractors: pro-rated where applicable.

## Request Process
1. Check team calendar and coverage.
2. Submit request in HR system with dates and type.
3. Manager approves; HR confirms balance.
4. Update OOO message and calendar.

## Documentation
- Attach medical notes for sick leave >2 days.
- Keep records for audit (12 months).

## Blackout Periods
- Critical business windows require director approval.

## Escalation
- Unresolved issues → HR Business Partner.

## Effective Date & Review
Effective immediately; reviewed annually.

title: ATP Guidelines
summary: Standard for activity tracking, reviews and performance signaling.
body:
## Overview
The Activity Tracking & Performance (ATP) process ensures work is visible, measurable, and linked to goals.

## Objectives
- Increase transparency of outcomes
- Enable fair reviews and coaching
- Feed promotion and rewards decisions

## What to Track
- **Objectives** (quarterly)
- **Outcomes** (bi-weekly summaries)
- **Evidence** (links, artifacts, metrics)

## Cadence
- Weekly: update personal log
- Bi-weekly: manager check-in
- Quarterly: formal review and calibration

## Tooling
- Work items live in project tools (Jira/Azure DevOps);
- Summaries captured in the ATP workspace.

## Ratings
- Signals: **Exceeds / Meets / Building / Off-track**

## Governance
People Ops maintains the framework; managers ensure adherence.

title: DBP Support Guidelines
summary: SOP for intake, triage, escalation and closure of DBP support.
body:
## Scope
Covers support for Digital Business Platform (DBP) incidents and requests.

## Intake Channels
- Portal form (preferred)
- Email (auto-creates ticket)
- Chat escalation (high severity only)

## Triage
1. Validate severity (S1–S4)
2. Categorize (Access, Data, Workflow, Integration)
3. Assign owner and SLA clock

## SLAs
- **S1:** 15m response / 4h restore
- **S2:** 1h response / 1 business day
- **S3–S4:** Best effort within 3 business days

## Escalation
- S1: bridge call within 15 minutes; duty manager notified
- Vendor escalation via support contract

## Closure
- Confirm resolution with requester
- Document root cause and preventive action
- Post-incident review for S1/S2

## Metrics
First response time, time to restore, reopen rate.

title: Client Session Guidelines
summary: Practical guidance to prepare, lead, and follow up on every DQ client meeting.
body:
## Practical Guidelines for Effective Client Meetings

### 1. Preparation Before the Meeting
- Clearly define the purpose and objectives of the meeting.
- Identify and invite only relevant participants.
- Prepare a detailed agenda outlining topics, time allocations, and expected outcomes.
- Assign key roles (facilitator, note-taker, timekeeper).
- Create a meeting card on MS Teams to collaborate on context, purpose, and preparation.
- Create a logistics card on MS Teams (Admin | Logistics) for all logistical arrangements.
- Block the meeting in the DQ Logistics Calendar for visibility.
- Review LinkedIn profiles to understand stakeholders' backgrounds and expertise.
- Whenever possible, book client meetings 1–2 weeks in advance.
- Ensure all sessions are recorded and tracked.
- Tag and DM all associates involved in the client engagement.
- Prepare and share required materials and data at least one day prior to the session.
- Confirm meeting format and platform (in-person or virtual) and share relevant links.

### 2. Starting the Meeting
- Begin on time regardless of participant arrival.
- Clearly state the meeting objective and desired outcomes.
- Review the agenda and confirm time allocations.
- Establish ground rules (e.g., no interruptions, stay on topic, respect time limits).

### 3. Conducting the Meeting
- Stick to the agenda and keep discussions focused.
- Encourage balanced participation, especially from quieter members.
- Handle conflicts diplomatically, focusing on solutions.
- Summarize key points and decisions after each discussion item.
- Record all key takeaways, decisions, and action items in real time.

### 4. Closing the Meeting
- Review key decisions, action items, and assigned responsibilities.
- Confirm next steps and set follow-up timelines.
- Clarify the next meeting date or checkpoint.
- Thank participants and close the meeting on time.

### 5. Follow-Up After the Meeting
- Share meeting minutes or a summary within 24 hours.
- Clearly communicate action items, owners, and deadlines.
- Identify stakeholders' interests and priorities to align follow-up actions and partnership opportunities.
- Capture any Skunkworks initiatives the client could be interested in to guide potential collaboration.
- Tag and DM all relevant associates in the Client Engagement thread.
- Track progress on follow-up actions and offer support where needed.
- Provide or request feedback via DQ CoE to continuously improve future sessions.

title: Task | Azure DevOps Guidelines
summary: SOP for creating, linking and tracking tasks in Azure DevOps.
body:
## Work Item Hygiene
- Title = verb + outcome
- Acceptance criteria as bullet list
- Link to parent story/bug and PR

## Creating a Task
1. Use the team project template
2. Set iteration/sprint and area path
3. Add estimates and acceptance criteria

## Linking
- PRs and Builds must link to the work item
- Close via commit message keywords when merged

## Boards & Queries
- Use team board views for daily stand-ups
- Saved queries for triage and WIP limits

## Definition of Done
- CI passes, code reviewed, tests updated, production checks green, documentation updated

title: Blueprint Management Guidelines
summary: Process for creating, approving and versioning delivery blueprints.
body:
## Purpose
Ensure reusable delivery blueprints are high-quality, versioned, and governed.

## Lifecycle
1. **Draft**: authored by domain SME
2. **Review**: peer and PMO review
3. **Approve**: sign-off by owner
4. **Publish**: catalog entry with version tag
5. **Retire**: superseded, archived

## Versioning Rules
- SemVer (MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH)
- Changelog and migration notes required

## Quality Gates
- Customer outcomes defined
- Risks and controls identified
- Templates and metrics attached

## Ownership
- Blueprint owner maintains roadmap and reviews every 6 months

title: Agile Working Guidelines
summary: Agreed behaviors and rhythms for agile collaboration and delivery.
body:
## Principles
- Value outcomes over outputs
- Short feedback loops
- Transparent work and WIP limits

## Team Rhythms
- Daily stand-up (15 min)
- Planning (every sprint)
- Review & Retrospective (end of sprint)

## Cadence Health
- Stable velocity within ±20%
- No carry-over without explicit reason

## Collaboration Norms
- Default to public channels
- Decision logs and action owners
- Async first; meeting hygiene

title: Meetings & Sessions Optimization
summary: Principles to maximize outcomes and reduce meeting waste.
body:
## When to Meet
- Decision, alignment, risk review, or complex design
- Otherwise: async update

## Design Your Meeting
- Clear outcome
- Invite the minimum
- Timebox and agenda

## Good Practices
- Start with context and constraints
- Use a visible decision log
- End with owners and dates

## Anti-patterns
- No outcome, too many attendees, hidden decisions, no action tracking

title: DQ Scrum Guidelines
summary: Standard Scrum events, roles, artifacts and definitions of done.
body:
## Roles
Product Owner, Scrum Master, Developers

## Events & Timeboxes
- Sprint (1–4 weeks)
- Planning (max 8h for 1-month sprint)
- Daily Scrum (15m)
- Review (4h for 1-month sprint)
- Retrospective (3h for 1-month sprint)

## Artifacts
- Product Backlog with ordered items
- Sprint Backlog (sprint goal + plan)
- Increment (potentially shippable)

## DoD (Definition of Done)
- Code reviewed, tests updated, security checks pass, documentation updated, deployed to target environment

title: Stakeholder Catalog Guidelines
summary: Process for discovery, segmentation and engagement play.
body:
## Objectives
- Maintain a single view of stakeholders
- Increase engagement quality and traceability

## Steps
1. Discovery & intake (sources: CRM, projects, events)
2. Normalize and deduplicate
3. Segment (influence, interest, role)
4. Map objectives and engagement plan
5. Review quarterly and after major changes

## Governance
- Data steward assigned; audit trail required.

title: DQ Content Strategy
summary: Best practices for planning, production and distribution of content.
body:
## Goals
- Drive qualified demand and loyalty
- Educate and enable customers

## Pillars
- Audience insights → topics
- Editorial calendar → campaigns
- Distribution mix → owned/earned/paid

## Production Workflow
Brief → Outline → Draft → Review → Approve → Publish → Repurpose

## KPIs
- Consumption (views, time), engagement (CTR), conversion, assisted pipeline

## Governance
- Source of truth in the content repo; quarterly refresh

title: DQ Social Media Guidelines

body:
## Scope
Applies to all employees posting on behalf of the brand.

## Brand Voice
- Clear, helpful, respectful
- No confidential info or speculation

## Approval Workflow
- Draft → Brand review → Compliance check → Publish

## Responses & Escalation
- Acknowledge within 2h business time
- Escalate sensitive topics to PR/legal

Hate speech, harassment, copyrighted material without rights.

title: DQ Forum Guidelines
summary: SOP for creating, moderating and resolving forum threads.
body:
## Purpose
Keep forums constructive, searchable, and resolved.

## Creating a Thread
- Clear title and context
- One question per thread

## Moderation
- Tag correctly; merge duplicates
- Move off-topic posts
- Enforce code of conduct

## Resolution
- Mark accepted answer
- Summarize solution for future search

## Escalation
- Abuse → report to moderators; severe issues → HR/Legal

summary: Structured and standardized processes for the implementation, approval, and management of remote work across DQ.
body:
# WFH Guideline Overview

The following instructional section outlines the structure of the Work From Home (WFH) Guidelines, providing a clear framework for how the document is organized and applied across all DQ functions. Each section serves a specific purpose to ensure clarity, alignment, and operational effectiveness in managing remote work practices.

## 1. Purpose and Scope

### Purpose

The purpose of the Work From Home (WFH) Guidelines is to provide structured and standardized processes for the implementation, approval, and management of remote work across DQ.

These guidelines aim to ensure that remote work practices promote accountability, productivity, and collaboration while maintaining operational efficiency, cultural alignment, and compliance with company standards.

### Scope

These guidelines apply to all DQ Associates across.

They cover the end-to-end process of requesting, approving, monitoring, and reporting WFH arrangements to ensure transparency and consistency across all practices.

## 2. Roles and Responsibilities

**➜ Associate:**

- Submit WFH requests at least 24 hours in advance via the HR Channel, clearly stating the reason and date(s).
- Post daily action updates on the HR Channel and include relevant channel engagement links for visibility.
- Remain active and visible on DQ Live24 throughout the workday.

**➜ Line Manager:**

- Review and provide pre-approval for WFH requests based on operational needs.
- Monitor the associate's deliverables and ensure accountability for remote work outcomes.
- Provide performance feedback where necessary and flag repeated non-compliance cases to HR.

**➜ Human Resources (HR):**

- Provide final approval for all WFH requests once Line Manager pre-approval is confirmed.
- Ensure requests align with company policy and maintain consistency across departments.

**➜ HR & Administration (HRA):**

- Oversee overall compliance and adherence to WFH guidelines.

## 3. Guiding Principles and Controls

### Work From Home Guiding Principles

**➜ Transparency:**

Ensure all WFH activities, updates, and deliverables are visible to Line Managers, HR, and relevant teams to maintain operational clarity.

**➜ Accountability:**

Associates remain responsible for meeting deliverables, timelines, and communication expectations while working remotely.

**➜ Equity and Fairness:**

WFH approvals are granted objectively, based on role suitability, performance, and business continuity requirements.

**➜ Compliance and Discipline:**

Adhere strictly to WFH policies, timelines, and approval workflows to maintain order and consistency across departments.

**➜ Collaboration and Communication:**

Promote open communication and team engagement through consistent updates and use of approved DQ collaboration tools.

**➜ Data Security and Confidentiality:**

Safeguard company data and maintain information security standards when handling sensitive or operational material remotely.

## 4. Processes

### WFH Processes

**➜ Submit request:**

Associate submits WFH request at least 24 hours in advance via the HR Channel, including reason, date(s) and expected working hours.

**➜ Line Manager pre-approval:**

Line Manager reviews impact on workload and team coverage and provides pre-approval or requests modifications.

**➜ HR final approval:**

HR verifies policy compliance, gives final approval, and records the decision in the HR tracker. HR notifies the Associate and Line Manager.

**➜ Post the day plan:**

On the approved WFH day, the Associate creates a thread in the HR Channel before work starts, posting actions for the day and channel engagement links.

**➜ Clock-in & presence:**

Associate clocks in on DQ Shifts at start time and remains active/visible on DQ Live24 during working hours.

**➜ Work execution & communication:**

Follow the posted day plan, provide regular brief updates in the thread (e.g., morning, mid-day, end-of-day), answer messages promptly, and join scheduled calls.

**➜ Record deliverables:**

At day's end, Associate posts completed tasks, outstanding actions, and any blockers in the HR thread for visibility and handover.

**➜ Monitoring & compliance:**

HRA and Line Manager monitor adherence. Repeated non-compliance triggers formal review per policy.

**➜ Escalation & follow-up:**

Failure to post daily updates or remain active on DQ Live24 will be treated as an unpaid workday.

Non-compliance may result in revocation of WFH privileges or performance review.

**NB**

Kindly note that any adjustments or exceptions for lateness, whether while joining DQ Live or arriving at the office, must be approved by your Line Manager. This process ensures fairness and consistency across all associates.

## 5. Tools and Resources

### WFH Tools and Resources

**➜ DQ Live24:** For visibility and communication.

**➜ DQ Logistics Channel:** For sharing approved WFH schedules.

**➜ HR Portal:** For submitting requests and tracking WFH history

## 6. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

### WFH Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

**➜ Timely Submission:** 100% of WFH requests submitted at least 24 hours in advance through the HR Channel.

**➜ Approval Compliance:** 100% adherence to the approval workflow — Line Manager pre-approval followed by HR final approval.

**➜ Visibility Compliance:** 100% of approved WFH associates post daily actions and engagement links on the HR Channel.

**➜ Attendance Accuracy:** 100% of WFH attendance tracked via DQ Shifts and DQ Live24.

**➜ Policy Adherence:** Zero incidents of unapproved or non-compliant WFH cases per review cycle.

**➜ Performance Consistency:** Maintain productivity levels equivalent to in-office performance during WFH periods.

## 7. Compliance and Governance

### WFH Compliance and Governance

**➜ Approval Protocol:** All WFH requests must follow the 24-hour advance notice rule, with Line Manager pre-approval and HR final approval before commencement.

**➜ Daily Accountability:** Associates must post daily actions and engagement links on the HR Channel. Failure to do so will result in the day being treated as unpaid.

**➜ Attendance Verification:** WFH attendance must be logged through DQ Live24 for validation and compliance tracking.

**➜ HRA Oversight:** The HRA team is responsible for monitoring adherence, maintaining consistency, and reporting any non-compliance cases to HR and Management.

## 8. Review and Update Schedule

### WFH Review and Update Schedule

**➜ Quarterly Review:** The WFH Guidelines will be reviewed every three months by the HR and Admin teams to ensure continued alignment with DQ's operational and compliance needs.

**➜ Ad-hoc Updates:** Adjustments may be made at any time if gaps, inefficiencies, or process improvements are identified through feedback or audits.
